content: The [Labour Front](/wiki/Labour_Front) (LF) won the most seats in the [1955 Singaporean general election](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election) and was thus invited to form a cabinet. Its leader, [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)), entered negotiations with other parties to build a coalition government. After three days of discussion, a minority coalition comprising the LF, [UMNO](/wiki/United_Malays_National_Organisation) and [MCA](/wiki/Malayan_Chinese_Association) was formed. This marked Singapore's first cabinet and a significant step towards full self-governance. ## List of ministers PortfolioMinisterPolitical partyTerm startTerm end[Chief title: First David Marshall Cabinet
